result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Non-Compliant Pretrial Supervision Report from JusticePoint dated 11/02/22
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
matter set for ptc 11/28/22 at 10:00
Pretrial Supervision Status Report from JusticePoint dated 10/21/22

9:03 AM Defendant Justin J Korntved in court.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Justin J Korntved.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard are 22CF-129, 22CF-394, 22CF-20.

Court calls cases.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Court addresses 22CF-394 first.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Defense waives time limits. 

Court addresses 22CF-129 next.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Defense waives time limits. 
Court offers matters to be set for a pretrial first.
At conclusion of pretrial, indicate on the sheet if a prelim has to be scheduled.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pretrial Supervision Status Report dated 10-07-2022

1:28 PM Defendant Justin J Korntved in court.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Justin J Korntved.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Cassidy calls case 22CF20 and states the appearances. 

Atty Raabe is ready to proceed with the motion hearing for 22CF20. 
Atty Cassidy responds and states the reasons why the motion should be denied. 
Atty Raabe makes statements regarding the reasons for the motion filed. 
Court states that the affidavit does not reflect the information Atty Raabe has provided that court today.

1:32 PM Atty Raabe calls Justin Korntved as a witness, and Mr. Korntved is sworn in by the Clerk. 
Direct exam by Atty Raabe.

1:36 PM Cross exam by Atty Cassidy. 

1:44 PM No re-direct questions from Atty Raabe. 
Mr. Korntved is excused from the witness stand by the Court.

Atty Raabe asks the Court to take note for transcripts for cases as stated on record and to admit into evidence.
Atty Cassidy objects to these transcripts being admitted into evidence for reasons stated on record. 
Atty Raabe makes arguments.
Court makes statements regarding hearsay. 
Atty Raabe responds further and makes arguments regarding residual evidence.
Court notes that the items are already in the file, have been reviewed by the Court, and the Court will allow to be in file, and referenced to for this hearing.
Court questions if that is sufficient as they are not marked as exhibits.
Atty Raabe agrees and makes further arguments regarding the motion.
Court questions Atty Raabe.
Atty Raabe responds and makes further arguments.
Atty Cassidy believes the defense has not met its burden today for arguments made on record. 
Court states that Atty Raabe has the final burden, so Court will allow final arguments.
Atty Raabe makes final arguments for this motion.

Court states findings for the record. 

BY THE COURT: Motion denied for collateral attack for reasons stated on record.

2:10 PM Court questions if cases 22CF129 and 22CF394 were called prior as they need to be addressed. 
Court states that Atty Raabe is not assigned to these cases but asks that he stick around for reasons stated on record. 

Court reviews the petition and letter from Justice Point in the case file. 
Court questions defendant regarding income and expenses to determine indigence.

BY THE COURT: Before considering court-appointed counsel, Mr. Korvtved is ordered to go the public defender's office within the next two days.
If denied for the public defender, Mr. Kornvted to bring the denial letter to the judicial assistant in branch 1. 

There is a problem with the Justice Point reporting as it appears there's non-compliance from Mr. Kornvted.
Court is giving Mr. Kornvted opportunity to fix before taking any action. 
Court explains that the Justice Point reporting is part of bond conditions.

BY THE COURT: Mr. Kornvted is ordered to go to Justice Point today.

Atty Cassidy questions scheduling for case 22CF20 with cases 22CF129 and 22CF394.
Court responds.

BY THE COURT: This matter to be set for a status hearing.
Cases 22CF129 and 22CF394 are to be set for an adjourned initial appearance.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant did not receive a copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

Court questions if an information has been filed.
Atty responds.

09:10 AM Defendant Justin J Korntved appeared by video. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney (Atty)  Adam Raabe in court for Defendant Justin J Korntved.  
Atty Mutchler states appearances.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Defendant does not want a preliminary hearing. 

Atty Raabe addresses bond modification.
State has no opposition to bond modification.

BY THE COURT: $500 cash bond granted.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney /s/ PB 02/01/22
Initial appearance on February 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:26 AM Defendant Justin J Korntved in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Justin J Korntved appeared by video. 
Atty Mutchler states appearances. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Defendant states he filed paperwork for a court appointed attorney.
Court questions Mr. Korntved.
Mr. Korntved makes statements.
Court swears in Mr. Korntved.
Court questions Mr. Korntved.
Mr. Korntved responds.
Court finds Mr. Korntved indigent.

To make payments of $100 each month to county.
If defendant is found eligible for public defender representation, that payment plan to be converted to their attorney fees. 
Court questions Attorney Raabe.
Atty Raabe responds.

Court appoints Atty Raabe.
Bond to be continued.

  Initial appearance scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on January 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Justin J Korntved appeared by video, in custody, from Waupaca County Jail. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for State of Wisconsin.

9:15 AM Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Defendant intends to get an attorney on this.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Court questions Defendant.

Court will not address the bond today.
Court advises Defendant to apply at public defender's office.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter from wife of the defendant dated 01/14/22
Initial Appearance set for January 18, 2022 @ 9:00 a.m. in Br 2

Do not go upon premises where alcohol is sold for consumption to the public on site.
Do not drive unless absolutely sober, and with a valid driver's license only.
Participate in the Pretrial Supervision Program and comply with its requirements regarding assessment and testing.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Dodge appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Renc (Public Defender) appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Operating While Intoxicate, Operating with a prohibited blood alcohol content, OAR. 
Atty Renc does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Renc does makes bond arguments.

Initial Appearance scheduled for: January 18th @ 9 a.m. in Branch 2.

Do not go upon premises where alcohol is sold for consumption to the public on site.
Do not drive unless absolutetly sober and with a valid driver's license only.
Participate in the pretrial supervision program and comply with its requirements regarding assessment and testing.
